Sequence Information.Peptide Name: 2K4L (Temporin-1CEc analog, synthetic AMPs, Lys-rich, Leu-rich; XXA, UCLL1c; BBMm)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, amphibians, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature.Author: Ji F, Zhao Y, Jiang F, Shang D. 2022
Literature.Title: Membrane mechanism of temporin-1CEc, an antimicrobial peptide isolated from the skin secretions of Rana chensinensis, and its systemic analogs.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (84.62%) toTemporin-1CEc analog 2K2LL: 46%, K: 31%, I: 15%.Chemical modification: C-terminal amidation.Activity: active against E. coli (MIC 1.56 uM),  P. aeruginosa (MIC 3.13 uM), E. aerogenes (MIC 1.56 uM), E. cloacae (MIC 6.25 uM), K. pneumoniae (MIC 3.13 uM), S. aureus (MIC 3.13 uM), B. cereus (MIC6.25 uM), S. lactis (MIC 1.56 uM), E. faecalis (MIC 1.56 uM), E. faecium (MIC 1.56 uM). Also inhibited biofilm formation:bacteria:S. epidermidis.MOA:bacteria:S. epidermidis: permeated bacterial membranes.Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 50% TFE or 30 mM SDS.In vitro toxicity: Human RBC: HC50 62.5 uM,  hemolytic.
